title: Project/ Change Manager
text:
Job Ref: PCM01 
We are currently recruiting for a Project/ Change Manager, with strong financial experience, to lead a key business transformation project, working with senior stakeholders to identify process improvements across Practice Areas and Financial Control. 
The incumbent will be able to demonstrate previous experience in delivering finance and business process improvement projects within time, cost and quality success criteria. 
Key responsibilities: 
- Full lifecycle project management from start-up to closure, using industry standard methodologies 
- Financial control, forecasting and managing budgets 
- Planning and control including estimating, stage planning, risk and issue management, change management and communications 
- The use of structured project governance, within a project management office 
- Effective management of senior stakeholders and communication at all levels 
- Lead large and diverse teams using traditional and virtual team management techniques 
- Supplier relationship management 
- Contribute to the continuous improvement of the project management methodology. 
- Prepare and maintain accurate project plans and documentation in line with the firmâ€™s methodology 
- Manage project delivery in line with defined objectives, scope and constraints 
- Manage project issues and risks including the development of contingency plans 
- Manage, monitor and motivate cross-functional project teams 
- Manage project change control 
- Prepare status reports and manage the Project Board 
- Manage business change and transition of services to operational groups. 
Person specification: 
- Experience in leading change and delivering financial and accounting process improvement projects 
- Determining current and future states, gap analysis, future state modelling and pilot management 
- An ability to shape ambiguous ideas into clear actions and deliverables 
- Commercially astute with a strong track record in project management 
- Experience of working in regulatory, financial, legal or professional services sectors with financial and accounting systems literacy 
- PRINCE 2 Practitioner or equivalent accreditation 
- A self-starter able to work with little supervision 
- Has a natural leadership style with matrix management experience 
- Influencing and negotiating with senior stakeholders 
- The ability to inspire and motivate teams to successful project completion 
- Be able to communicate effectively with individuals and groups at all levels within the firm, including Partners, Directors, Associates and Senior Managers 
- Work flexibly in an environment with competing priorities and aggressive deadlines 
Hours: 09:30 - 17:30 (Mon - Fri) 
Start date: ASAP
